dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: ...so, like, twelve schoolchildren, all 14, in the Mangystau region, they were, um, poisoned.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ...so, like, twelve schoolchildren, all fourteen, in the Mangystau region, they were, um, poisoned.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Twelve schoolchildren were poisoned in the Mangystau region... The affected teenagers, all aged 14, are receiving outpatient treatment under medical supervision.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Poisoned? You really believe that? Or is it just, like, bad food they're calling "poisoning"?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Poisoned? You really believe that? Or is it just, like, bad food they're calling poisoning?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the Ministry of Healthcare is investigating, officially, and they published a statement. Manashin General Education School.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the Ministry of Healthcare is investigating, officially, and they published a statement. Manashin General Education School.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakhstan™s Ministry of Healthcare has launched an investigation into the incident. The official statement was published on the Ministry™s website on Thursday, April 3. According to the press service, the incident occurred among students of the Manashin General Education School in the Beineu district.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: "Investigating." What does that even mean? They'll just say it was, uh, a rogue potato, won't they?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Investigating. What does that even mean? They'll just say it was, uh, a rogue potato, won't they?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: They sealed off the cafeteria, um, and collected samples: food, water, surface swabs, even tested staff for infections.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They sealed off the cafeteria, um, and collected samples: food, water, surface swabs, even tested staff for infections.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It was also reported that the district police department sealed off the school™s cafeteria following the incident. As part of the investigation, specialists visited the site, collected samples of food products, water, surface swabs, and disinfectants, and tested the cafeteria staff for intestinal infections.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Samples. Great. By the time they're "processed," any real evidence will be long gone. Convenient, don't you think?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Samples. Great. By the time they're processed, any real evidence will be long gone. Convenient, don't you think?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: The kids had vomiting, weakness, diarrhea, abdominal pain. But their condition is now, uh, reported as satisfactory.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The kids had vomiting, weakness, diarrhea, abdominal pain. But their condition is now, uh, reported as satisfactory.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Upon arriving at the emergency room, they complained of vomiting, general weakness, diarrhea, and abdominal pain. Their condition is currently reported as satisfactory.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: "Satisfactory." Right. After being, you know, poisoned. And parents think it's poor-quality food. Shocker.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Satisfactory. Right. After being, you know, poisoned. And parents think it's poor-quality food. Shocker.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Parents interviewed by authorities believe the illness was caused by poor-quality food served in the school cafeteria, the Ministry of Healthcare stated.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: They've sent letters to police departments, education, prosecutors... a special task force was even created.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They've sent letters to police departments, education, prosecutors... a special task force was even created.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In addition, a special task force has been created under the regional akimat. In connection with the children's poisoning, official letters have been sent to the Manashinsky district police department, the Mangystau regional police department, the education department, and both district and regional prosecutor™s offices, the statement said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: More letters, more task forces. That's always the answer, isn't it? Just more bureaucracy pretending to, like, do something.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: More letters, more task forces. That's always the answer, isn't it? Just more bureaucracy pretending to, like, do something.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: But it's serious, twelve kids, uh, had to go to the emergency room.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it's serious, twelve kids, uh, had to go to the emergency room.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Upon arriving at the emergency room, they complained of vomiting, general weakness, diarrhea, and abdominal pain.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Serious, yes. Like the other mass poisoning in Zhambyl region in March? Funny how these things keep happening, isn't it? And nothing changes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Serious, yes. Like the other mass poisoning in Zhambyl region in March? Funny how these things keep happening, isn't it? And nothing changes.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As a reminder, a mass poisoning of children also occurred in the Zhambyl region in mid-March.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: They are, like, receiving outpatient treatment under medical supervision now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They are, like, receiving outpatient treatment under medical supervision now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The affected teenagers, all aged 14, are receiving outpatient treatment under medical supervision.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Medical supervision. Sure. Until the next "unexplained" mass sickness at another school, I guess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Medical supervision. Sure. Until the next unexplained mass sickness at another school, I guess.
